DOC.HEAD: Pittsburgh Plans Renewed Fight Against Courthouse Menorah
DOC.TEXT: A Jewish group erected a 40-foot menorah outside the City-County Building, and the city said it was renewing legal attempts to have the holiday symbol removed from public property. The city planned to petition the U.S. Supreme Court today to have the Hanukkah symbol taken down, attorneys said. The city contends it has the right to determine what is permitted in front of the building. The Orthodox Jewish Chabad group was permitted to erect the display Monday under protection of a restraining order issued last week by U.S. Supreme Court Justice William J. Brennan Jr. Brennan upheld U.S. District Judge Barron P. McCune's order preventing the city from blocking Chabad's installation of the menorah. McCune ruled that the courthouse steps are a public forum open to all types of expression. The eight-day Jewish Feast of Lights ends Saturday.
